subanswer.text:
To solve this problem, let O denote the cost of the orange fruit in cents, and G denote the cost of the green apple. According to the information provided, the relationship between their costs is expressed mathematically as follows:

\[ G = 3O - 5 \]

It is stated that collectively, buying them once equates to paying tenfold their joint cost augmented with an additional percentage representing sales tax equivalent to twenty percent (\( T \)). This scenario yields another expression reflecting cumulative monetary exchange occurrences:

\[ 10(G + O) + T = P_{total} \]

Herein \( P_{total} \) signifies the entire payment expected before accounting for sales levies imposed over purchases made solely comprising said fruits inclusive of all transactional hitchings encountered throughout checkouts incited by prolonged waiting periods occasioned either through deliberate customer exit strategies rendering surplus confectionery offerings void henceforth impacting fiscal estimations negligibly precluding instantaneous financial discrepancies arising consequently post promotional period engagement effectuated subsequent exchanges entailing regressions resulting
